channel.title: Color editing
channel.description:
Hey guys. Please don't have a go at me if this is in the wrong section. I have never done anything with models nor 'ints' for models, therefore, I wouldn't know if this is client-sided or sever-sided.
Anyway, is it possible to edit the color of an item? And I don't mean items like godswords I mean items like helmets, for instance. If any one knows how, or if any one knows a tutorial or a link to one, I would really appreciate it...
Thanks ~ Ziege Terra ~

item.title: Color editing
item.dc:creator: @Praga69 Praga69
item.description:
@Praga69 wrote:

Well you might have to remove the item and then color how you want ect… and then make new ints for new item and code the item back into the server

Read full topic

item.title: Color editing
item.dc:creator: @Ziege_Terra_117 Ziege Terra 117
item.description:
@Ziege_Terra_117 wrote:

So I’d assume i could just copy an item int and just change the color???

I just wanted to make 'Spined" armor into different colors like blue and black and so on…

Is it as easy as I think it would be, or does it actually involve ‘difficulty’?

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Color editing
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Yes it is. I have personally made a few sets of armors, boots, gloves, and swords from just plain iron, dragon, and mystic items. Also, i have gotten plenty of compliments on it. I am not exactly sure how to explain it. I do know though, that you need the original model to figure out its original colors to recolor that specific region.

Read full topic
